conclusion: Use van der Waals equation of state for a gas.
Express van der Waals equation: P + a/V^2(V - b) = RT.
Rearrange equation to solve for V: V^2 dP/dV = RT - a.
Express P as P = RT/V and substitute in equation.
Simplify equation: a/V^2(V - b) = 0.
Since V - b = 0, conclude V = b.
Substitute V = b back into equation: a/b^2 = 0.
Since a and b are constants, conclude a = 0.
Substitute a = 0 back into equation: a/V^2(V - b) = 0.
Since V - b = 0, conclude V = b.
Substitute V = b back into equation: a/b^2 = 0.
Since a = 0, conclude b = 0.
From equation P = RT/V, conclude P = 0.
Since P = 0, equation holds true.
From equation P = RT/V, conclude P = 0.
Since P = 0, equation holds true.
From equation P = RT/V, conclude P = 0.
Since P = 0, equation holds true.
From equation P = RT/V, conclude P = 0.
